page.title: 12THE POULTRY FARM
page.content: Mr.Timothy Wood has a poultry farm in S.Cheriton with 53,000 hens kept in batteries. He has no male chicks. He feeds them on high protein layer mash. The farm covers 5 acres and 4,000 eggs are laid daily. He sells over 20,000 eggs a week to local villages. He has some vans of his own each van covering about 500 miles a week. He does not export any of his produce.Eggs that are cracked or not quite perfect are liquified. Mr.Wood has lived in this area 10 years and employs mostly local people on a casual basis when he requires extra staff. He says that the common market has made no differences to his work. The staff start work at 8.00 a.m.Only 4% of eggs are cracked and 90% of eggs produced are perfect.
